name: Bear Lake (Emigrant)
description: A picturesque alpine lake in the Emigrant Wilderness with granite domes and excellent swimming. Less traveled than other Sierra destinations, offering solitude and classic High Sierra beauty without permit hassles.
permit_notes: FREE permit - no quota system! Self-issue available 24/7 at Summit Ranger Station. One-night camping limit at Bear Lake.

name: Bearpaw Meadow Campground
region: Sequoia National Park - Kings Canyon National Park
description: Bearpaw Meadow Campground is a picturesque destination nestled in the heart of the Sierra Nevada, surrounded by towering trees and stunning mountain vistas. Great base for exploring High Sierra trails.
permit_notes: A wilderness permit is required for overnight camping. Bear canisters are recommended. Quotas may apply during peak season.

name: Big Pine Lakes (First & Second Lake)
description: Spectacular turquoise alpine lakes fed by the Palisade Glacier - the southernmost glacier in the US. First and Second Lakes offer accessible camping with views of Temple Crag and the Palisades.
permit_notes: Inyo National Forest permit. EXTREMELY competitive - one of the hardest Sierra permits to get. Bear canister REQUIRED.

name: Chickenfoot Lake
description: Part of the stunning Little Lakes Valley chain, Chickenfoot Lake sits at nearly 11,000 feet with minimal elevation gain from the highest trailhead in the Sierra (Mosquito Flat).
permit_notes: Inyo National Forest permit. Very competitive permits - book exactly 6 months out. Bear canister REQUIRED.

name: Cliff Lake
description: A beautiful alpine lake nestled beneath dramatic granite cliffs in the Dinkey Lakes Wilderness. Numerous interconnected lakes perfect for day hikes from base camp.
permit_notes: Sierra National Forest permit. Bear canister recommended. Less crowded than nearby wilderness areas.

name: Cottonwood Lakes
description: High alpine lakes at over 11,000 feet in the Golden Trout Wilderness, accessed via Horseshoe Meadow. Stunning views of the Sierra crest. Lake #3 offers the best camping.
permit_notes: Inyo National Forest permit. 60% quota released 6 months ahead, 40% released 2 weeks ahead. Bear canister REQUIRED. No campfires.

name: East Lake
description: A stunning alpine lake accessed via the Green Creek Trail in the Hoover Wilderness. Dramatic mountain backdrop with excellent fishing.
permit_notes: Hoover Wilderness permit. 50% quota reservable in advance, 50% available 3 days before. Bear canister REQUIRED.

name: Ediza Lake
description: A stunning alpine lake beneath the dramatic Minarets, one of the most photographed mountain scenes in the Sierra. Access via Shadow Creek Trail from Agnew Meadows.
permit_notes: Inyo National Forest permit. Quota of 12 advance + 8 walk-up per day. Bear canister REQUIRED. Shuttle required to Agnew Meadows in summer.

name: Emigrant Lake
description: The namesake lake of the Emigrant Wilderness offers a relatively easy approach with classic granite Sierra scenery. Less crowded than nearby wilderness areas.
permit_notes: FREE permit - no quota system! Can get permit by phone up to 7 days ahead or self-issue at Summit Ranger Station 24/7.

name: Gilmore Lake
description: A beautiful alpine lake nestled at the base of Mt. Tallac with stunning views of Lake Tahoe from the surrounding ridges. Great base camp for day hikes.
permit_notes: Desolation Wilderness permit. Bear canister REQUIRED. No campfires. Can combine with Mt. Tallac summit day hike.

name: Green Lake
description: A beautiful lake along the Green Creek Trail, closer to the trailhead than East Lake. Excellent camping, fishing, and mountain views.
permit_notes: Hoover Wilderness permit. 50% advance, 50% available 3 days before. Bear canister REQUIRED.

name: Heather Lake
description: A beautiful alpine lake along the Lakes Trail in Sequoia National Park, part of a chain that includes Aster and Pear Lakes.
permit_notes: Sequoia & Kings Canyon permit. Part of the Lakes Trail chain. Bear canister required.

name: Kearsarge Lakes
description: A cluster of beautiful alpine lakes accessed via Onion Valley, one of the highest trailheads in the Sierra. Gateway to the backcountry with JMT/PCT connections.
permit_notes: Inyo National Forest permit. Popular as JMT resupply point. Bear canister REQUIRED. Steep but well-maintained trail.

name: Lake Aloha
description: The largest lake in Desolation Wilderness, a stunning shallow lake dotted with granite islands. Feels like a High Sierra archipelago.
permit_notes: Desolation Wilderness permit. Water taxi available from Echo Lakes ($22/person each way). Bear canister REQUIRED. No campfires.

name: Long Lake (Bishop Creek)
description: A gorgeous alpine lake along the Bishop Pass Trail with stunning views of the Inconsolable Range. Part of a chain of lakes.
permit_notes: Inyo National Forest permit. Popular trailhead - competitive permits. Bear canister REQUIRED. Excellent fishing.

name: Lower Velma Lake
description: One of the classic Desolation Wilderness destinations with stunning granite basins and crystal-clear water. Easy access to Middle and Upper Velma Lakes.
permit_notes: Desolation Wilderness permit. Zone quota system - book your destination zone. Bear canister REQUIRED. No campfires.

name: Mosquito Lakes
description: A chain of five stunning alpine lakes in the Mineral King area of Sequoia National Park. Classic High Sierra scenery.
permit_notes: Sequoia & Kings Canyon permit. Bear canister required. Mineral King road is winding and slow - allow extra time.

name: Pear Lake
description: A stunning alpine lake in the Tablelands area of Sequoia National Park. Dramatic granite cirque setting and deep blue water.
permit_notes: Sequoia & Kings Canyon permit. Popular destination - book early. Bear canister required. Winter ski hut at Pear Lake.

name: Redwood Canyon
description: A unique grove of giant sequoias in Kings Canyon National Park. Peaceful escape with towering redwoods and excellent wildlife viewing.
permit_notes: Sequoia & Kings Canyon permit. Bear canister required. 6-month advance booking.

name: Susie Lake
description: Susie Lake is a stunning alpine lake nestled within the scenic Desolation Wilderness, known for its crystal-clear waters and breathtaking mountain views.
permit_notes: Desolation Wilderness permit. Bear canisters are mandatory. Quotas are in place during peak season.

name: Thousand Island Lake
description: One of the most iconic alpine lakes in the Sierra with countless granite islands and Banner Peak as a backdrop. A bucket-list destination on the JMT/PCT.
permit_notes: Inyo National Forest permit via Agnew Meadows. Very competitive permits. Bear canister REQUIRED.

name: Virginia Lakes Basin
description: A stunning high alpine basin with multiple lakes surrounded by dramatic peaks. Short approach makes this accessible while still feeling remote.
permit_notes: Hoover Wilderness permit. Less crowded than Green Creek area. Bear canister REQUIRED. Beautiful fall colors in September.

name: Rae Lakes
description: One of the most stunning alpine lake chains in the Sierra, featuring crystal-clear turquoise waters surrounded by dramatic peaks including Fin Dome. A highlight of the famous Rae Lakes Loop.
permit_notes: Sequoia & Kings Canyon permit. Part of the iconic Rae Lakes Loop. Bear canister REQUIRED. Very competitive permits.

name: Evolution Basin
description: A spectacular high alpine basin along the John Muir Trail, featuring Evolution Lake and stunning views of the Evolution Range. One of the most beautiful stretches of the JMT.
permit_notes: Inyo National Forest permit. Remote and challenging. Bear canister REQUIRED. Multi-day trip recommended.

name: Duck Lake
description: A beautiful high alpine lake accessed via Duck Pass from Coldwater Campground near Mammoth. Stunning views and excellent fishing in a glacial cirque.
permit_notes: Inyo National Forest permit. Popular Mammoth Lakes trailhead. Bear canister REQUIRED. Can continue to Purple Lake.

name: Purple Lake
description: A scenic alpine lake along the John Muir Trail, nestled in a beautiful cirque with excellent camping spots. Popular overnight destination from Duck Pass.
permit_notes: Inyo National Forest permit. On the JMT. Bear canister REQUIRED. Great basecamp for exploring the area.

name: Garnet Lake
description: A stunning lake beneath Banner Peak and Mt. Ritter, one of the most scenic spots in the Ansel Adams Wilderness. Less crowded than nearby Thousand Island Lake.
permit_notes: Inyo National Forest permit. Adjacent to Thousand Island Lake. Bear canister REQUIRED. Excellent swimming.

name: Sabrina Basin (Blue Lake)
description: A stunning alpine basin with multiple lakes including Blue Lake, Donkey Lake, and Baboon Lakes. Accessed via Lake Sabrina with spectacular granite scenery.
permit_notes: Inyo National Forest permit. Bishop area trailhead. Bear canister REQUIRED. Many lake options for basecamp.

name: Tamarack Lake
description: A beautiful lake accessible via the Echo Lakes Trail, featuring classic Desolation granite scenery and excellent swimming. Good alternative to more crowded destinations.
permit_notes: Desolation Wilderness permit. Can use Echo Lakes water taxi to shorten approach. Bear canister REQUIRED. No campfires.

name: 20 Lakes Basin
description: A stunning collection of alpine lakes near Saddlebag Lake, one of the highest drive-to lakes in California. Short approaches to multiple beautiful lakes.
permit_notes: Hoover Wilderness permit. Water taxi available across Saddlebag Lake. Bear canister REQUIRED. High altitude - acclimate first.

name: Lake Virginia
description: A beautiful lake along the John Muir Trail between Purple Lake and Tully Hole. Excellent camping with mountain views and access to Fish Creek hot springs.
permit_notes: Inyo National Forest permit. On the JMT south of Purple Lake. Bear canister REQUIRED. Fish Creek hot springs nearby.

name: Matterhorn Canyon
description: A remote and spectacular canyon in northern Yosemite with stunning views of Matterhorn Peak. Less traveled than other Yosemite destinations.
permit_notes: Yosemite Wilderness permit via Twin Lakes. Remote and challenging. Bear canister REQUIRED. Multi-day trip recommended.
